newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: EU agrees to boost Commission president's role.
newsitem.headline: EU agrees to boost Commission president's role.

text.p: Future European Commission presidents will be true chief executives and participate in the choice of their fellow commissioners, Dutch Prime Minister Wim Kok said on Friday.
European Union leaders, meeting in the Dutch resort of Noordwijk to prepare for a new EU treaty, had reached agreement on strengthening the Commission president's role, he said.
Under a proposal discussed at Friday's summit, new presidents will, as now, be chosen by EU leaders and be subject a vote of confidence by the European Parliament.
He or she would then participate in the choice of commissioners, Currently, only member states choose their representatives on the EU executive.
"An organisation must have a chief...and the president should be able to have true authority over his or her commissioners," French President Jacques Chirac said separately.
Once the Commission team is chosen it would be subject as a body to a vote of confidence by the Parliament.
